Name:
Kempenfelt
Assiniboine
Namesake:
Rear Admiral Richard Kempenfelt
Assiniboine River
Fate:
Transferred to Royal Canadian Navy, 19 October 1939

Sold for scrapping but wrecked en route to breakers on 10 November 1945
Wreck broken up in situ in 1952
Badge: Badge: On a field Black a Sword proper between two wings greenover two wavelets Silver and Blue.
Displacement:
1,390 long tons (1,410 t) (standard)
1,901 long tons (1,932 t) (deep)
Propulsion:
2 × shafts
2 × Parsons geared steam turbines
3 × Yarrow water-tube boilers
Range: 5,500 nmi (10,200 km; 6,300 mi) at 15 knots (28 km/h; 17 mph)
Armament:
4 × 1 - QF 4.7-inch Mark IX guns
1 × 1 - QF 3-inch 20 cwt anti-aircraft gun
2 × 1 - QF 2-pounder Mk II AA guns
2 × 4 - 21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
6 × depth charges, 3 chutes
